title: ATLAS Score for Clostridium Difficile Infection
description: Predicts response to therapy in C. diff patients

references.citation: Miller MA, Louie T, Mullane K, Weiss K, Lentnek A, Golan Y, et al. Derivation and validation of a simple clinical bedside score (ATLAS) for Clostridium difficile infection which predicts response to vancomycin therapy. BMC Infect Dis. 2013;13:148.

Cohen SH, Gerding DN, Johnson S, Kelly CP, Loo VG, McDonald LC, et al. Clinical practice guidelines for Clostridium difficile infection in adults: 2010 update by the society for healthcare epidemiology of America (SHEA) and the infectious diseases society of America (IDSA). Infect Control Hosp Epidemiol. 2010;31(5):431-55.

formula: Sum of points from: Age ≥65 (+1), Treatment with Systemic Antibiotics (+2), Leukocytosis >15,000/μL (+1), Albumin <2.5 g/dL (+1), Serum Creatinine >1.5× baseline (+1)

parameters.name: age_65_or_older
parameters.label: Age ≥65 years
parameters.description: Patient is 65 years of age or older

parameters.name: systemic_antibiotics
parameters.label: Treatment with Systemic Antibiotics
parameters.description: Patient is currently on systemic antibiotic therapy (other than for C. diff treatment)

parameters.name: leukocytosis
parameters.label: Leukocytosis >15,000/μL
parameters.description: White blood cell count greater than 15,000 cells per microliter

parameters.name: low_albumin
parameters.label: Albumin <2.5 g/dL
parameters.description: Serum albumin level less than 2.5 g/dL (25 g/L)

parameters.name: elevated_creatinine
parameters.label: Serum Creatinine >1.5× baseline
parameters.description: Serum creatinine level greater than 1.5 times the baseline/normal value

result.name: atlas_score
result.description: ATLAS score for predicting response to C. difficile therapy

ranges.label: Low Risk
ranges.description: Good response to vancomycin therapy expected. Low risk of treatment failure.
ranges.management: Standard vancomycin therapy should be effective. Monitor clinical response.

ranges.label: High Risk
ranges.description: Poor response to vancomycin therapy expected. High risk of treatment failure.
ranges.management: Consider alternative therapies such as fidaxomicin or fecal microbiota transplantation. Close monitoring required.

indications: Patients with confirmed Clostridium difficile infection
Treatment planning for C. diff infection
contraindications: Should not be used in isolation for treatment decisions
limitations: Derived from patients treated with vancomycin specifically
May not apply to other C. diff treatments
External validation in diverse populations needed

evidence_summary: The ATLAS score was derived and validated in a multicenter study to predict response to vancomycin therapy in C. difficile infection. It identifies patients at high risk for treatment failure who may benefit from alternative therapeutic approaches.
author: Dr. Mark Miller
